CRIME ALERT: On June 6, 2023, at 4:53 pm, the Greenbelt Police Department received a call reporting a Hyundai Elantra drivingerratically. The Elantra then crashed into another car in the 7700 block of Hanover Pkwy resulting in minor injuries, and witnessessaw the juvenile driver run over the Spellman Overpass. It was determined that the car had been stolen from Greenbelt. Officerssaturated the area, located the 16-year-old male driver, and took him into custody after a short foot chase in the area of 24 RidgeRd.

Victim reported that on 5/19/23 at approximately 8 p.m., four to five males approached him outside of his building, assaulted him,and took his money.

Victim reported that on 5/27/23 at an unknown time, he was in his apartment when an unknown number of people broke bothlocks on the door and  attempted to open it. The victim said  the chain lock was engaged, and the males left when theydiscovered it.

On June 9, 2023 at approximately 11:26 pm, a Greenbelt Police officer was conducting a premise check in the area ofCherrywood Ter and Cherrywood Ct when he spotted multiple people walking through the parking lot and looking into cars. Heturned his floodlights on, and the group scattered. Additional officers arrived to assist in the search for the group, and twoindividuals were found and detained, a 16-year-old boy and 19-year-old man. Officers located a handgun with an extendedmagazine in the manâ€™s backpack, and he was arrested on multiple firearms charges.

Victim reported that when he returned to his apartment, four unknown people were inside and they told him they used the bottomlock to get in. The four then left the house before officers arrived. Officers cleared the apartment and found no one. The apartmenthad extenisive damages and was filled with trash.
